wikipedia_page.main: Gareth Salisbury (born 11 March 1941) is a Welsh former professional footballer who played as a forward in The Football League both in the Welsh National Football Team and for Wrexham, Norwich City, Luton Town, Colchester United and Chesterfield. He also went on to represent Kidderminster Harriers and Bangor City FC in the English non-leagues. Later moving to Melbourne Australia to Play in the Victoria State league with Juventus FC, Voted Player of the year in 1970 when the team won the grand slam, consisting of the Victorian State League and  Australia Cup, the first national football competition.

response: Franklin's first–ever signing, Derek Trevis, was an ever–present during the season, as was Duncan Forbes, while Billy Stark ended the season as top scorer with 14 league and cup goals. It was an injury–plagued season for Colchester, with Barrie Aitchison, Mike Grice, Martyn King, Gareth Salisbury and Billy Stark all ruled out as early as September, meaning Franklin had to call upon Noel Kearney, a former Ipswich Town player who had been released by the club three months earlier. Kearney signed on a month–long trial and played three games for Colchester, all of which ended in defeat.
